oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Mercer Hall
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Detail of front, or west, view of Mercer Hall in Columbia, Tennessee. Shows the monumental two-story portico that is supported by four Corinthian columns with a bracketed frieze.
Mercer Hall, a Greek Revival style home, was built in 1838 for William Leacock. It later became the home of Episcopal Bishop James Hervey Otey who turned it into a boy's school.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Eason, W. Jeter
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Greek revival (Architecture); Dwellings--Tennessee; Architecture, Domestic--Tennessee
Houses; Columns; Corinthian order; Mansions; Porticoes (Porches); Friezes (Ornamental bands); Architectural decorations & ornaments
